items.title: Another election, 'no winner'? What’s at stake in Kosovo's snap vote
items.summary: The Balkan country is headed to the polls on Sunday, after nearly a year of political deadlock that's caused "colossal damage" to its economy.

items.title: Ready for take-off? Here's how international travel is changing in 2026
items.summary: From fresh international routes to new digital identity requirements, here's what you need to know about heading overseas next year.

items.title: Victoria Police name person of interest in Hanukkah car fire
items.summary: Victoria Police is searching for a person of interest as part of its early investigation into a suspected arson attack in south-east Melbourne.

items.title: Burnt out from 2025? Here's how to actually rest over the break
items.summary: December can be a stressful time of year, and not everyone returns to work refreshed after the festive season.

items.title: Streaming surge reveals how Australia's internet usage is changing
items.summary: New NBN data reveals how streaming, working from home and faster broadband are reshaping Australia's internet usage.

items.title: Türkiye arrests more than 100 suspected IS members over alleged terror plots, officials say
items.summary: The group was allegedly planning attacks during Christmas and New Year's celebrations, particularly against non-Muslims.

items.title: 'Shared longing for peace': King Charles praises Bondi heroes in Christmas message
items.summary: King Charles has spoken about overcoming uncertainty and division in his annual Christmas address.

items.title: Pope Leo decries conditions for Palestinians in Gaza in first Christmas sermon
items.summary: In an address from the balcony of St Peter's Basilica, the pontiff also called for an end to conflicts in Ukraine, Sudan, Thailand and Cambodia.

items.title: NSW Police invoke new powers to restrict Sydney protests for two weeks
items.summary: NSW Police have imposed temporary limits on public gatherings under emergency laws passed in response to the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Why Christmas can be lonely — and how charities are working to change that
items.summary: Christmas can be a challenging time for some. These groups are working to bring community to those who need it.

items.title: How Australia's migrant communities put their own spin on Christmas
items.summary: Around the world, and in migrant communities across Australia, a diverse range of customs give Christmas a unique flavour.

items.title: Your guide to holiday trading hours across Australia
items.summary: What's open this holiday season? Supermarket, retail, liquor, bank and medical trading hours across Australia.

items.title: Australian Christian leaders share Christmas message of ‘light’ and ‘hope’
items.summary: Christian leaders from across Australia have delivered their Christmas messages, saying light will overcome darkness in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: How to safely store your Christmas leftovers and avoid food poisoning
items.summary: If your Christmas feast has finished and you see large portions of food untouched on your table, you might only have a couple of hours to keep them.

items.title: US issues visa bans for five Europeans involved in technology regulation
items.summary: An EU spokesperson said it would seek answers from the United States about the "unjustified measures".

items.title: 'Evil presence': PM condemns suspected antisemitic firebombing of a car in Melbourne
items.summary: Detectives in Melbourne are investigating a suspicious antisemtic fire on Christmas Day.

items.title: Ukraine indicates troop withdrawals in new proposed peace deal
items.summary: The US-backed proposal stops short of recognising seized territory as Russian, though future Ukrainian withdrawals remain on the table.

items.title: US officials uncover another million documents potentially linked to Epstein
items.summary: It comes a week after hundreds of thousands of Epstein files were made public, many of which were redacted, angering both Republicans and Democrats.

items.title: 'Impossibly high threshold': Northern Territory bail laws facing High Court challenge
items.summary: An Aboriginal legal service in the NT will launch a challenge to laws it says undermine fundamental legal principles.

items.title: Minns defends 'extraordinary measures' after protest and gun laws pass
items.summary: NSW has passed sweeping legislation tightening gun laws and granting police expanded powers to restrict public protests following the Bondi attack.

items.title: Israeli president's planned post-Bondi-attack visit to Australia draws mixed reaction
items.summary: While mainstream Jewish organisations have welcomed Isaac Herzog's recently announced visit to Australia, others have expressed dismay.

items.summary: Some sunglasses can put you at risk of eye damage. Here's how to tell the difference.

items.title: How one phone call cost Vicky $47,000
items.summary: With Australia introducing world-first scam prevention legislation earlier this year, we hear from people who are seeking justice.

items.title: Christmas Day weather extremes across Australia
items.summary: Severe storms threaten Queensland, Melbourne will be cool and WA braces for extreme heat and bushfire warnings on Christmas Day.

items.title: Bondi heroes to be recognised in special honours list, Albanese announces
items.summary: The prime minister says the awards will be announced next year.
